units.title: Organoid split into three culture conditions
units.text: At day 35, organoids from each line were split into three different conditions: 1) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond as described above (with vitamin A); 2) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond (with vitamin A) plus 100 μM DEAB, an inhibitor of RA synthesis; or 3) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond as described above without vitamin A.
units.rationale: Defines the experimental groups for downstream analysis.

units.title: Nucleus isolation from fresh tissue without vitamin A
units.text: Nucleus isolation from fresh primary tissue described above except using B27 without vitamin A.
units.rationale: Specifies a modified nucleus isolation protocol.

units.title: Tissue dissociation for single-cell suspension
units.text: We used 1323-4 in Papain containing DNase I (DNase) for 30 min at 37 °C and samples were triturated to form a single-cell suspension.
units.rationale: Describes enzymatic digestion to obtain single cells.

units.title: Cell lysis and nucleus washing
units.text: Cells (10^6) were pelleted and lysed for 3 min in 100 μl chilled lysis buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween-20, 0.1% Igepal CA-630, 0.01% digitonin, 1% bovine serum albumin (BSA)). Lysed cells were then washed with 1 ml chilled wash buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.4, 10 mM NaCl, 3 mM MgCl2, 0.1% Tween-20, 1% BSA) and nuclei were pelleted at 500g for 5 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Provides the lysis and purification steps for nuclei.

units.title: Single-cell RNA-seq library generation
units.text: Single-cell RNA-seq libraries were generated using the 10X Genomics Chromium 3′ Gene Expression Kit. In brief, single cells were loaded onto chromium chips with a capture target of 10,000 cells per sample.
units.rationale: Outlines the preparation of scRNA‑seq libraries.

units.title: Bulk ATAC-seq library preparation
units.text: Bulk ATAC-seq libraries were generated as described57. In brief, 50,000 nuclei were permeablized and tagmented. Tagmented chromatin libraries were generated and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq with a target sequencing depth of 50 million reads per library.

units.title: CUT&Tag library preparation for H3K27ac
units.text: H3K27ac CUT&Tag libraries were prepared as previously described60, with modifications. In brief, cells were dissociated from human cortical tissue as described above. Fifty thousand cell aliquots were reconstituted in neural induction medium at a density of 10,000 cells per well in 200 μl CUT&Tag wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche)). Nuclei were isolated by resuspending cell pellets in 200 μl dig-wash buffer...
units.rationale: Specifies the CUT&Tag protocol for histone modification profiling.

units.title: Primary antibody incubation and wash
units.text: Primary antibody (H3K27ac, Cell Signaling 8173) was added at a dilution of 1:50 in 100 μl dig-wash buffer and incubated overnight at 4 °C on an overhead rotary shaker rotating at 90 rpm, and changed to Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM)/F12-based medium containing 1× glutamax, 1× N2, 1× B27 without vitamin A and 1× antibiotic–antimycotic (anti-anti). Excess primary antibody was removed by pelleting the nuclei at 600g and washing twice in 200 μl dig-wash buffer.
units.rationale: Describes antibody binding and removal steps.

units.title: pA‑Tn5 tagmentation and cleanup
units.text: pA-Tn5 was added at a dilution of 1:100 in 100 μl dig-med buffer (0.05% digitonin, 20 mM HEPES, pH 7.5, 300 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail) and nuclei were incubated at room temperature for 1 h while rotating. Unbound pA-Tn5 was removed by pelleting the nuclei at 300g and washing twice in 200 μl dig-med buffer.
units.rationale: Covers the tagmentation reaction and subsequent cleanup.

units.title: Library PCR amplification conditions
units.text: Libraries were amplified with the cycling conditions: 72 °C for 5 min; 98 °C for 30 s; 12 cycles of 98 °C for 10 s and 63 °C for 30 s; final extension at 72 °C for 1 min and hold at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Provides the PCR program for library enrichment.
